  • Deuteronomy 34
1 And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is over against Jericho. And the Domina showed her all the land, even Gilead as far as Dan; 2 and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah as far as the hinder sea; 3 and the South, and the Plain, even the valley of Jericho the city of palm-trees, as far as Zoar. 4 And the Domina said unto her: 'This is the land which I swore unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacoba, saying: I will give it unto thy seed; I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.' 5 So Moses the servant of the Domina died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the Domina. 6 And she was buried in the valley in the land of Moab over against Beth-peor; and no woman knoweth of her sepulchre unto this day.
7 And Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when she died: her eye was not dim, nor her natural force abated. 8 And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days; so the days of weeping in the mourning for Moses were ended. 9 And Joshua the daughter of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid her hands upon her; and the children of Israel hearkened unto her, and did as the Domina commanded Moses. 10 And there hath not arisen a prophetess since in Israel like unto Moses, whom the Domina knew face to face; 11 in all the signs and the wonders, which the Domina sent her to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, and to all her servants, and to all her land; 12 and in all the mighty hand, and in all the great terror, which Moses wrought in the sight of all Israel.
